results.title: The Union Moved. The Beloved Mosaic Mural Couldn’t.
results.abstract: The architect David Adjaye spurred a painstaking re-creation of a doomed artwork for its new home — and added a homage to the union’s place in social justice history.

multimedia.caption: The mosaic artisan Stephen Miotto recreated the mural, which can be seen from the street. His godfather created the original with two partners.

results.title: Whitney Lays Off 15 Workers Amid Mounting Financial Losses

results.title: In ‘Summer Brother,’ Sibling Bonding During a Season of Turmoil
results.abstract: In Jaap Robben’s “Summer Brother,” a 13-year-old finds himself the default caregiver for his severely disabled brother. His dad’s a swindler. The bills are due. Disaster is inevitable.

results.title: ‘My Zoe’ Review: Julie Delpy’s Provocative Family Drama
results.abstract: The characters can be confoundingly self-involved, but Delpy finds unusual threads to pull you closer to them and their crises.

results.title: Lawrence Ferlinghetti, Poet Who Nurtured the Beats, Dies at 101

results.title: Hillary Clinton and Louise Penny to Write Political Thriller
results.abstract: “State of Terror,” set for release in October, is about a secretary of state confronting terrorism threats and a weakened nation.

results.title: How Plagues Shape the Landscape
results.abstract: From cholera to AIDS, epidemics have given rise to landmarks around the world, be they sculptures, churches or feats of engineering. In this dire moment, their histories resonate.
